comments: First 4 members are the divisors of 6 (the first perfect number), written in base 2 (see A135652, A135653, A135654, A135655). - _Omar E. Pol_, May 04 2008a(n) = A007088(A035522(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 02 2015
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
crossrefs: Cf. A035522 for same sequence but written in base 10.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, E. M. Rains
